ygData.subject: RE: Deleting /friend list (OT)
ygData.msgSnippet: ... True, but I ve gone through a similar problem of removing a small phrase or typo from the friends list and it s next to impossible to remove these as you
ygData.messageBody:
> From: Mike.Langlois@...
>
>
>
> Try putting the strings in quotes. This will keep the parser
> from getting
> confused by the spacer.
>
> IE /f "this is an error"
>
> Golias, Sol Ro

True, but I've gone through a similar problem of removing a small phrase or
typo from the friends list and it's next to impossible to remove these as
you must type it out exactly character for character. This is very difficult
in a long friend's name. But this is an excellent suggestion.

> From: John_Senior@...
>
> If I want to remove someone from my friend list I just type
> /friend soandso
> and it removes them, just type the name of the person you
> want to remove
> after the /friend
> Works for me, might be a bit tedious but it saves deleting files etc.
>
> Hope this helps
>
> Madagan Songweaver, Bard of 35 Songs - Veeshan Server

The difficulty was in the length of the phrase, not ignorance of how to
remove a standard friend name.

Original post:
> From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
>
> Is there anyway to delete your entire /friend list and start
> over? I typed
> in /friend to see who all was listed on there that I hadn't
> seen in a long
> time. I noticed that there were a couple of phrases listed
> in addition to
> players. Apparently I thought I was sending a /tell, /say,
> or /groupsay
> but
> instead I hit "/f" instead of "/t" so I ended up adding the
> phrase I typed
> to my friend list. When I type in /friend and get the entire
> list, there
> are
> a few blank spaces in front of the phrases. I have made
> numerous attempts
> at removing the phrase by adding one, two, three, etc spaces
> before I type
> in any letters. All this does is add another phrase to my
> friend list.
>
> I thinking if I delete my characters .opt file in the EQ
> directory this
> will
> delete my friends list as well as all my hotkeys. Will this work? My
> friends list is full so I need to free up the slots.
>
> Thanks
> Galtin of E'ci
